quote: Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the parent of all the others.
Nothing is more honorable than a grateful heart.
All the gratitude which he deserves is to be forgiven for helping us.
Gratitude is the sign of noble souls.
If you are grateful, I will certainly give you more.
Remember Me; I will remember you. And thank Me, and do not be ungrateful to Me.
Allah does not like whoever is treacherous and ungrateful.
And Allah has enjoined on man to show gratitude to Allah. And whoever is grateful is grateful for his own soul; but whoever is ungrateful—then indeed, Allah is Free of need, Praiseworthy.
Whoever does not thank people has not thanked God.
Do not be anxious about anything, but in every situation, by prayer and petition, with thanksgiving, let your requests be made known to God.
Give thanks to the LORD, for he is good; his love endures forever.
Enter his gates with thanksgiving and his courts with praise; give thanks to him and praise his name.
Who offers praise glorifies me; and to him who orders his conduct aright I shall show the salvation of God.
Praise the LORD. Give thanks to the LORD, for he is good; his love endures forever.
By him, then, let us continually offer the sacrifice of praise to God, that is, the fruit of lips that acknowledge his name.
It is more blessed to give than to receive.
When you arise in the morning think of what a privilege it is to be alive—to think, to enjoy, to love.
Be content with what you have; rejoice in the way things are.
If one offers Me with love and devotion a leaf, a flower, fruit or water, I will accept it.
A thankful heart is not only the greatest virtue, but the parent of all other virtues.
Wear gratitude like a cloak and it will feed every corner of your life.
Gratitude bestows reverence… altering forever the heart of him who gives and of him who receives.
Gratitude is riches. Complaint is poverty.
Reflect upon your present blessings—of which every man has many—not on your past misfortunes.
A grateful mind is a great mind which eventually attracts to itself great things.
Counsel and good wish are the only gifts we can give without ever parting with ourselves.
Gratitude is the memory of the heart.
Gratitude unlocks the fullness of life.
The roots of all goodness lie in the soil of appreciation for goodness.
Gratitude opens the door to the power, the wisdom, the creativity of the universe.
When I started counting my blessings, my whole life turned around.
The struggle ends when gratitude begins.
In ordinary life, we hardly realize that we receive a great deal more than we give.
The way to develop the best that is in a person is by appreciation and encouragement.
Gratitude is a powerful catalyst for happiness.
Happiness is the spiritual experience of living every minute with love, grace, and gratitude.
If the only prayer you ever say in your life is ‘thank you,’ that will be enough.
A grateful heart is a magnet for miracles.
Train yourself to find the blessing in everything.
Gratitude is a currency that we can mint for ourselves, and spend without fear of bankruptcy.
Ingratitude is always a kind of weakness. I have never known men of ability to be ungrateful.
Be grateful for whoever comes, because each has been sent as a guide from beyond.
The miracle is not that we do this work, but that we are happy to do it.
Stay close to anything that makes you glad you are alive.
If you look at what you have in life, you'll always have more.
If you aren't grateful for what you already have, what makes you think you would be happy with more?
Gratitude is the ability to experience life as a gift.
Gratitude is an antidote to negative emotions: envy, hostility, worry, and irritation.
Be thankful for problems. If they were less difficult, someone with less ability might have your job.
Gratitude can transform common days into thanksgivings, turn routine jobs into joy, and change ordinary opportunities into blessings.
The smallest act of gratitude toward God is to thank Him for all the blessings He has bestowed on us.
Gratitude is an offering precious in the sight of God, and it is one that the poorest of us can make if we choose.
A moment of gratitude makes a difference in your attitude.
Gratitude is the music of the heart when its chords are swept by the breeze of kindness.
The essence of all beautiful art, all great art, is gratitude.
Gratitude is the wine for the soul. Go on. Get drunk.
Gratitude is the open door to abundance.
When you focus on gratitude, you shift from what your life lacks to the abundance you already possess.
Gratitude paints little smiley faces on everything it touches.
Gratitude is the most exquisite form of courtesy.
Thankfulness is the natural impulse to express gratitude; thanksgiving is its following.
Gratitude is a powerful way to connect with the world and each other.
Let gratitude be your guide.
Find time to thank people who make a difference in your life.
Gratitude unlocks the door to joy, serenity, and fulfillment.
Make it a habit to tell people thank you—sincerely and without expecting anything in return.
The best and most beautiful things in the world must be felt with the heart.
Be present in all things and thankful for all things.
As we express our gratitude, the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.
I am happy because I’m grateful. That gratitude allows me to be happy.
Joy is the simplest form of gratitude.
No one who achieves success does so without the help of others—acknowledge this help with gratitude.
We often take for granted the things that most deserve our gratitude.
In daily life we must see that it is not happiness that makes us grateful, but gratefulness that makes us happy.
Feeling gratitude and not expressing it is like wrapping a present and not giving it.
Reflect upon your present blessings, of which every man has plenty.
